page.title: 03Kimbolton - Trade
page.content: Trade has always been concentrated within 200 metres of the old market- -place : Until recently there were about a score of the usual trade outlets : concern was expressed about the closure of a grocer's shop and a general shop - bowing to the competition of the cheaper, easily accessible, nationwide chains. However,within the last five years, the number of shops has grown by 50%. Many of these are 'lock-up' shops erected in a speculative manner within old-alleyways and inn-yards- by nature transitory, but at least suggesting promise for the future. The attraction is two-fold. A growing and reasonably prosperous population living in a setting that includes stylish shops and increasingly draws the tourist and casual shopper.
